briefdescription.para: True if list is circular, false if not.
True if list is horizontal, false if not.
The margin around each item (included in itemSize)
Gets the circular setting, previously set using setCircular().

simplesect.para: True if the list is circular (infinite), false if the list is not circular (finite).

briefdescription.para: Gets the drawable index of an item.

detaileddescription.para: If the number of items is smaller than the number of drawables and the DrawableList is circular, the same item can be in more than one drawable. In that case, calling this function again with the previously returned index as second parameter, the index of the next drawable containing the item will be returned.

parameterdescription.para: (Optional) Index of the previous drawable. If given, search starts after this index.

simplesect.para: The first drawable index with the given item. Returns -1 if the item is not in a drawable.

detaileddescription.para: Useful when the number of items is smaller than the number of drawables as the same item might be in more than one drawable on the screen (if the DrawableList is circular). The passed array will be filled with the drawable indices and the number of indices found is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Array where the drawable indices are stored.

simplesect.para: The number of drawable indices found.

detaileddescription.para: Gets drawable margin as set by setDrawables.

briefdescription.para: Gets drawable size as set by setDrawables.
Gets the orientation of the drawables, previously set using setHorizontal().

simplesect.para: True if it horizontal, false if it is vertical.

briefdescription.para: Gets item stored in a given Drawable.

detaileddescription.para: This equals the drawable size plus the drawable margin as set in setDrawables(). Equals getDrawableSize() + 2 * getDrawableMargin().

briefdescription.para: Gets number of drawables based on the size of each item and the size of the widget.
Gets number of items in the DrawableList, as previously set using setNumberOfItems().
Gets offset, as previously set using setOffset().

detaileddescription.para: After setting up the DrawableList it is possible to request how many drawables are needed to ensure that the list can always be drawn properly. If the DrawableList has been setup with fewer Drawables than the required number of drawables, part of the lower part of the DrawableList will look wrong.

The number of required drawables depend on the size of the widget and the size of the drawables and the margin around drawables. If there are fewer drawables than required, the widget will not display correctly. If there are more drawables than required, some will be left unused.

Item changed and drawables containing this item must be updated. This function can be called when an item has changed and needs to be updated on screen. If the given item is displayed on screen, possible more than once for cyclic lists, each drawable is request to refresh its content to reflect the new value.
Useful to call if the number or items, their size or other properties have changed.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the list is circular (infinite) or not.

detaileddescription.para: A circular list is a list where the first drawable re-appears after the last item in the list - and the last item in the list appears before the first item in the list.

parameterdescription.para: True if the list should be circular, false if the list should not be circular.

memberdef.argsstring: (DrawableListItemsInterface &drawableListItems, int16_t drawableItemIndexOffset, GenericCallback< DrawableListItemsInterface *, int16_t, int16_t > &updateDrawableCallback)
memberdef.name: setDrawables

detaileddescription.para:
These parameters are
The access class to the array of drawables
The offset in the drawableListItems array to start using drawable and
Callback to update the contents of a drawable.
drawableListItems
Number of drawables allocated.
drawableItemIndexOffset
The offset of the drawable item.
updateDrawableCallback
A callback to update the contents of a drawable.
getRequiredNumberOfDrawables

The drawable is is the size of each drawable in the list in the set direction of the list (this is enforced by the DrawableList class). The specified margin is added above and below each item for spacing. The entire size of an item is thus size + 2 * spacing.

For a horizontal list each element will be drawableSize high and have the same width as set using setWidth(). For a vertical list each element will be drawableSize wide and have the same height as set using setHeight().

parameterdescription.para: The margin around drawables (margin before and margin after).

briefdescription.para: Sets the height of this drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
If the list is horizontal, the height is also propagated to all drawables in the list.

briefdescription.para: Sets a horizontal or vertical layout.

detaileddescription.para: If parameter horizontal is set true, all drawables are arranged side by side. If horizontal is set false, the drawables are arranged above and below each other (vertically).

parameterdescription.para: True to align drawables horizontal, false to align drawables vertically.

simplesect.para: Default value is false, i.e. vertical layout.

briefdescription.para: Sets number of items in the list.

detaileddescription.para: This forces all drawables to be updated to ensure that the content is correct.

simplesect.para: The DrawableList is refreshed to reflect the change.

detaileddescription.para: Does not move to the given coordinate, but places the drawables and fill correct content into the drawables to give the impression that everything has been scrolled to the given coordinate.
Setting a value of 0 means that item 0 is at the start of the DrawableList. Setting a value of "-getItemSize()" places item 0 outside the start of the DrawableList and item 1 at the start of it.
Items that are completely outside of view, will be updated with new content using the provided callback from setDrawables(). Care is taken to not fill drawables more than strictly required.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of this drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.
If the list is vertical, the width is also propagated to all drawables in the list.

briefdescription.para: A container able to display many items using only a few drawables.

detaileddescription.para: This is done by only having drawables for visible items, and populating these drawables with new content when each of these become visible.
This means that all drawables must have an identical structure in some way, for example an Image or a Container with a button and a text.
